snippet: Mr. Boisjoly wrote a portentous memo six months before the Space Shuttle Challenger’s explosion, warning that if it was too cold, seals connecting sections of the shuttle’s rocket boosters could fail.
abstract: Roger Boisjoly, widely known as a whistle-blower in the federal investigation of the Challenger space shuttle disaster, dies at age 73.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Boisjoly wrote a portentous memo six months before the Space Shuttle Challenger’s explosion, warning that if it was too cold, seals connecting sections of the shuttle’s rocket boosters could fail.

headline.main: Roger Boisjoly, 73, Dies; Warned of Shuttle Danger
headline.print_headline: Roger Boisjoly, 73, Dies; Warned of Shuttle Danger
